meanings.def: from one side to the other side of something
examples: I drew a line across the page.
A grin spread across her face.
Where's the nearest bridge across the river?

meanings.def: on the other side of something
examples: There's a bank right across the street.

meanings.def: on or over a part of the body
examples: He hit him across the face.
It's too tight across the back.

meanings.def: in every part of a place, group of people, etc.
examples: Her family is scattered across the country.
This view is common across all sections of the community.

meanings.def: knowing a lot about something; covering or in control of something
examples: We need someone who is across all the issues.
Radio 8 will be across events as they unfold.

meanings.def: from one side to the other side
examples: It's too wide. We can't swim across.
The yard measures about 50 feet across.

meanings.def: in a particular direction towards or at somebody/something
examples: When my name was called, he looked across at me.
There's a school just across from our house.
